page.title: 07Torquay Museum-Local History
page.content: In 1844 eighteen Torquay men got together because they liked history, and formed The Torquay Natural History Society.They kept on getting more and more artefacts so they decided to build a museum to keep them in.Torquay Museum was built in 1874 near Lisburne Square.Robert Sheddon built the museum which took two years to build.The Museum has many photographic plates,flowers,insect collections and geological and archaeological specimins.There is a mummified child which was aged between 6 and 8.People used to believe if you put them in a tomb they would rise from the dead.A display shows that the earth was formed 4,600 million years ago.First came shellfish and then fish 450 million years ago.Some of the artefacts come from Kents Cavern.The Museum arranges lectures and walks.
